net.hudup.core.alg

Interface CompositeRecommender

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Alg, AlgRemote, CompositeAlg, java.util.EventListener, Exportable, Inspectable, Recommender, RecommenderRemote, java.rmi.Remote, java.io.Serializable, SetupAlgListener
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RecommendContextPrefilter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompositeRecommenderAbstract, ExternalServerRecommender, RecommendContextPrefilterImpl

    @Composite
public interface CompositeRecommender
extends Recommender, CompositeAlg
    Recommendation strategy is defined as the co-ordination of recommendation algorithms such as collaborative filtering and content-based filtering in accordance with coherent process so as to achieve the best result of recommendation. In simplest form, strategy is identified with a recommendation algorithm. Recommender service is the most complex service because it implements both algorithms and strategies and applies these strategies in accordance with concrete situation. CompositeRecommender represents the recommendation strategy, called composite recommender. CompositeRecommender is combination of other Recommender algorithms in order to produce the best list of recommended items. So CompositeRecommender stores a list of internal recommender (s) in its configuration returned from Alg.getConfig() method.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Field Detail

      • INNER_RECOMMENDER

        static final java.lang.String INNER_RECOMMENDER
        CompositeRecommender stores a list of internal recommender (s) in its configuration returned from Alg.getConfig() method. Such list has a key specified by this constant.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getInnerRecommenders

        AlgList getInnerRecommenders()
        CompositeRecommender stores a list of internal recommender (s) in its configuration returned from Alg.getConfig() method. This method gets such recommender list from the configuration.
        Returns:
        list of inner recommender (s).
